data: The Culm, which rises in Somersetshire, and hastening into a fairer land (as the border waters wisely do) falls into the Exe near Killerton, formerly was a lovely trout stream, such as perverts the Devonshire angler from due respect toward Father Thames and the other canals round London.
Culm | Somersetshire | Exe | Killerton | Devonshire | Father Thames | London

Crocker's Hole
From "Slain By The Doones" By R. D. Blackmore
